explanations_en: Wrong. Earthquakes don't happen randomly. They occur at specific locations where tectonic plates meet and interact. Most earthquakes happen along fault lines, which are boundaries between plates.

Correct! Earth's crust is broken into large pieces called tectonic plates that float on the semi-molten mantle below. These plates constantly move very slowly. When they grind against each other, get stuck, then suddenly slip, the stored energy is released as seismic waves - that's an earthquake! Most occur at plate boundaries.

Wrong. While underground explosions (like nuclear tests) can cause minor tremors, natural earthquakes are caused by tectonic plate movements, not explosions. The energy comes from the slow buildup of stress along fault lines.

Wrong. Gravity doesn't cause earthquakes. While gravity affects plate tectonics indirectly, earthquakes are caused by the movement and collision of tectonic plates driven by convection currents in Earth's mantle, not by gravity pulling the earth.
explanations_zh: 不对。地震并非随机发生，它们出现在构造板块相遇和相互作用的特定地点。大多数地震发生在断层线上，即板块之间的边界。
正确！地壳破裂成巨大的板块，称为构造板块，它们漂浮在下方的半熔融地幔上。这些板块持续缓慢移动。当它们相互摩擦、卡住后突然滑动时，储存的能量以地震波的形式释放——这就是地震！大多数地震发生在板块边界。
错误。虽然地下爆炸（如核试验）可能引发轻微震动，但自然地震是由构造板块运动引起的，而非爆炸。其能量来源于断层线上应力的缓慢积累。
错误。重力并不直接引发地震。虽然重力间接影响板块构造，但地震是由地幔中的对流驱动板块运动与碰撞所致，而非重力对地球的牵引作用。

explanations_en: Wrong. It's not the mountain getting hot - the heat comes from deep inside Earth. Volcanoes form where magma from the mantle can reach the surface. The mountain is just the cone built up from previous eruptions.

Correct! Deep underground, rock melts into magma due to extreme heat and pressure. Magma is less dense than surrounding rock, so it rises. As it rises, dissolved gases expand and pressure builds. When pressure exceeds the strength of the overlying rock, the volcano erupts! Magma can reach the surface through cracks or weak spots in Earth's crust.

Wrong. While gas bubbles in magma do contribute to explosive eruptions by expanding, they're not the primary cause. The fundamental cause is magma pressure. Gases make eruptions more violent, but pressure buildup from rising magma is what drives eruptions.

Wrong. While earthquakes and volcanic eruptions are related (both occur at plate boundaries), earthquakes don't cause eruptions. Both are symptoms of tectonic activity. The eruption is caused by magma pressure, though earthquakes can sometimes trigger eruptions that were already ready to happen.
explanations_zh: 不对。并非山体发热，热量源自地球深处。火山形成于地幔岩浆能够到达地表之处，而山体只是由先前喷发物堆积而成的锥形结构。
正确！在地球深处，岩石因极高的温度和压力熔化成岩浆。岩浆密度低于周围岩石，因此会上升。上升过程中，溶解的气体膨胀，压力积聚。当压力超过上覆岩石的强度时，火山便会喷发！岩浆可通过地壳的裂缝或薄弱处抵达地表。
错误。虽然岩浆中的气泡因膨胀而加剧了爆炸性喷发，但它们并非主要原因。根本原因在于岩浆压力。气体使喷发更为猛烈，但上升岩浆导致的压力积累才是驱动喷发的关键。
错误。虽然地震和火山喷发有关联（两者都发生在板块边界），但地震并不会引发火山喷发。它们都是构造活动的表现。火山喷发是由岩浆压力引起的，尽管地震有时可能触发那些已经蓄势待发的喷发。

explanations_en: Correct! For billions of years, rain has weathered rocks on land, dissolving minerals including salts. Rivers carry these dissolved minerals to the ocean. Water evaporates, but the salts stay behind, accumulating over time. Underwater volcanic activity also adds minerals. The ocean has been collecting these salts for over 3 billion years!

Wrong. Sea creatures don't produce salt. In fact, marine organisms must adapt to the salty environment. Some filter salt out, others maintain salt balance. The salt comes from rock weathering and volcanic activity, not biological processes.

Wrong. While underwater volcanoes do contribute some minerals to the ocean, they're not the main source of salt. The primary source is weathering of rocks on land over billions of years. Rivers constantly carry dissolved minerals to the sea.

Wrong. Evaporation is the result, not the cause. Evaporation does concentrate salt in areas like the Dead Sea, but it doesn't explain where the salt came from originally. The salt is from weathered rocks carried to the ocean by rivers over geological time.
explanations_zh: 正确！数十亿年来，雨水不断侵蚀陆地岩石，溶解包括盐类在内的矿物质。河流将这些溶解的矿物质带入海洋。水分蒸发，而盐分则留存下来，随时间逐渐累积。海底火山活动也贡献了矿物质。海洋收集这些盐分已超过30亿年！
错误。海洋生物并不产生盐分。实际上，它们必须适应咸水环境，有些会过滤掉盐分，有些则维持体内盐分平衡。盐分主要来源于岩石风化和火山活动，而非生物过程。
错误。虽然海底火山确实向海洋贡献了一些矿物质，但它们并非盐分的主要来源。主要来源是数十亿年来陆地上岩石的风化作用。河流不断将溶解的矿物质带入海洋。
错误。蒸发是结果，而非原因。蒸发确实会使死海等地的盐分浓缩，但这并未解释盐最初来自何处。盐分源自地质时期内河流将风化岩石带入海洋。

questions.question_en: Why do mountains have snow on top?
explanations_en: Wrong. While precipitation does fall from clouds at high altitudes, this doesn't explain why it's snow rather than rain, or why snow stays on top. The key is that temperature decreases with altitude.

Correct! Temperature decreases about 6.5°C per 1000 meters of altitude. This is called the environmental lapse rate. Above a certain altitude (the snow line), it's cold enough for precipitation to fall as snow and for snow to remain frozen year-round. Even tropical mountains can have permanent snow at high elevations! The thinner air also holds less heat.

Wrong. Wind doesn't carry snow upward to deposit on mountains. Snow forms when water vapor in cold air crystallizes. Mountain tops are colder due to altitude, so precipitation falls as snow there and stays frozen.

Wrong. Being closer to clouds doesn't make it colder. In fact, clouds form at various altitudes. Mountains have snow because temperature decreases with altitude due to lower air pressure and thinner atmosphere, which holds less heat. It's the cold temperature that creates and preserves snow.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然降水确实从高空的云层中降落，但这并未解释为何是雪而非雨，或雪为何能停留在地表。关键在于温度随海拔升高而降低。
正确！海拔每升高1000米，气温大约下降6.5摄氏度，这被称为环境递减率。在某个海拔高度（雪线）以上，气温足够低，使得降水以雪的形式落下，并且积雪能常年不化。即使是热带的高山，在高海拔地区也可能有终年积雪！此外，空气越稀薄，保温能力也越差。
错误。风不会将雪吹上山堆积。雪是冷空气中的水蒸气结晶形成的。山顶因海拔高而更冷，因此降水以雪的形式落下并保持冻结状态。
不对。离云更近并不会更冷。实际上，云在不同高度形成。山上有雪是因为随着海拔升高，气压降低、大气变薄，保温能力减弱导致温度下降。正是低温造就并维持了积雪。

questions.question_en: Why are there waves in the ocean?
choices_en: Moon pulls water up and down
explanations_en: Wrong. Fish can create small ripples, but ocean waves are far too large to be caused by sea creatures. Waves are primarily created by wind, with the wave size depending on wind speed, duration, and fetch (distance over water).

Correct! Wind blowing across the ocean transfers energy to the water through friction. This creates ripples that grow into waves. Wave size depends on wind speed, how long it blows, and the distance (fetch) over which it blows. The water itself doesn't move forward - energy does! Only the wave form travels; water particles move in circular orbits.

Wrong. While the moon does affect ocean water, it causes tides (rise and fall over hours), not waves (which occur every few seconds). Tides are different from waves. Regular ocean waves are caused by wind, not lunar gravitational pull.

Wrong. The ocean floor doesn't push water to create waves. Waves are surface phenomena caused by wind. However, underwater earthquakes can create special waves called tsunamis, but regular ocean waves come from wind friction on the surface.
explanations_zh: 错误。鱼类能产生小涟漪，但海浪的规模远非海洋生物所能引起。海浪主要由风产生，其大小取决于风速、持续时间和风区长度（风吹过水面的距离）。
正确！风吹过海面时，通过摩擦力将能量传递给水体，形成涟漪并逐渐发展为波浪。波浪的大小取决于风速、持续时间以及风吹过的距离（风区）。水体本身并不向前移动，传递的是能量！只有波形在行进，水分子实则做着圆周运动。
错误。虽然月球确实影响海水，但它引起的是潮汐（数小时内的涨落），而非波浪（每隔几秒发生一次）。潮汐与波浪不同。常规的海浪是由风引起的，而非月球引力。
错误。海底并不会推动水形成波浪。波浪是由风引起的表面现象。不过，水下地震会产生一种特殊的波浪，称为海啸，但常规的海浪是由风在表面摩擦产生的。

questions.question_en: Why does sand exist at beaches?
choices_en: Rocks eroded over millions of years
explanations_en: Wrong. The ocean doesn't create sand - it transports and deposits it. Sand comes from the weathering and erosion of rocks, minerals, and sometimes shells over extremely long periods. Ocean waves and currents move the sand to beaches.

Correct! Sand is mostly tiny fragments of rocks and minerals, created by weathering and erosion over millions of years. Rivers carry these particles to the ocean, where waves and currents sort and deposit them on beaches. Beach sand composition varies - some is quartz from granite, some is volcanic rock, some is coral or shell fragments! White sand beaches have more shell and coral content.

Wrong. While some beach sand does contain shell fragments, especially on tropical beaches, most sand comes from eroded rocks. Shells can break down into sand-sized particles but aren't the primary source. Rock erosion over geological time creates most beach sand.

Wrong. Desert sand rarely reaches beaches. Beach sand is locally sourced from nearby rock erosion and river deposits. Desert sand grains are actually more rounded from wind erosion, while beach sand is more angular from water action. They form through different processes.
explanations_zh: 错误。海洋并不制造沙子，而是搬运和沉积沙子。沙子来源于岩石、矿物以及有时贝壳在极长时间内的风化和侵蚀。海浪和海流将沙子带到海滩上。
正确！沙子主要由岩石和矿物的微小碎片构成，是数百万年风化和侵蚀的产物。河流将这些颗粒带入海洋，海浪和海流在沙滩上对它们进行分类和沉积。海滩沙子的成分各异——有的是花岗岩中的石英，有的是火山岩，还有的是珊瑚或贝壳碎片！白色沙滩的贝壳和珊瑚含量更高。
错误。虽然一些海滩沙确实含有贝壳碎片，尤其是在热带海滩上，但大多数沙子来源于岩石风化。贝壳可以分解成沙粒大小的颗粒，但并非主要来源。地质时期内岩石的风化形成了大部分海滩沙。
错误。沙漠中的沙子很少到达海滩。海滩沙主要来源于当地岩石的风化和河流沉积。实际上，沙漠沙粒因风蚀作用而更为圆润，而海滩沙则因水流作用显得棱角分明。它们是通过不同的过程形成的。

questions.question_en: Why do rivers flow to the ocean?
explanations_en: Wrong. The ocean doesn't have magnetic properties that pull water. Water is not magnetic. Rivers flow because of gravity - they follow the path of least resistance downhill, and oceans are at the lowest elevation.

Correct! Water always flows downhill due to gravity, following the path of least resistance. Rivers start at high elevations (mountains, hills) and flow toward the lowest point - usually the ocean. The land surface naturally slopes toward the sea. Rivers carve valleys over time, creating channels that guide the flow. All rivers eventually reach the ocean or an inland lake/sea at a lower elevation!

Wrong. Earth's rotation does affect ocean currents and wind patterns (Coriolis effect), but it doesn't push rivers toward the ocean. Rivers flow downhill due to gravity. The direction is determined by topography (landscape slope), not Earth's rotation.

Wrong. Rivers don't follow underground tunnels - they flow on the surface along channels they've carved through erosion. Groundwater can flow underground, but rivers are surface water flowing downhill due to gravity, creating their own paths over geological time.
explanations_zh: 错误。海洋并不具有吸引水的磁性，水本身并不带磁性。河流之所以流动是因为重力作用——它们沿着阻力最小的路径向下流淌，而海洋处于最低海拔位置。
正确！水因重力总是往低处流，沿着阻力最小的路径前进。河流发源于高海拔地区（如山脉、丘陵），流向最低点——通常是海洋。地表自然向海洋倾斜。河流经年累月冲刷出河谷，形成引导水流的河道。所有河流最终都会汇入海洋或海拔更低的内陆湖泊/海域！
错误。地球自转确实影响洋流和风带（科里奥利效应），但并不会推动河流流向海洋。河流因重力作用向下流动，其流向由地形（地势坡度）决定，而非地球自转。
错误。河流并不流经地下隧道——它们沿着因侵蚀而形成的河道在地表流动。地下水可以在地下流动，但河流是地表水，受重力作用向下流动，在漫长的地质年代中自行开辟出路径。

explanations_en: Wrong. While some animals live in caves or enlarge small holes, they don't create large cave systems. Most caves form through chemical dissolution of rock by water, a process taking thousands to millions of years.

Correct! Most caves form in limestone rock through a process called dissolution. Rainwater absorbs carbon dioxide from air and soil, becoming slightly acidic. This weak carbonic acid slowly dissolves limestone as it seeps through cracks. Over thousands of years, this creates underground caverns. Stalactites and stalagmites form from minerals redeposited by dripping water!

Wrong. While earthquakes can crack rocks and create fissures, they don't create the large hollow chambers we call caves. Cave formation is a slow chemical process of rock dissolution by water, not sudden mechanical breaking.

Wrong. Wind erosion can create shallow rock shelters in deserts, but not deep underground cave systems. Most caves form through water dissolving soluble rocks like limestone underground. Wind erosion is a surface process and too weak to create large underground chambers.
explanations_zh: 不对。虽然有些动物栖息于洞穴或扩大小洞，但它们并不会形成大型洞穴系统。大多数洞穴是由水对岩石的化学溶解作用形成的，这一过程需要数千年至数百万年。
正确！大多数洞穴是在石灰岩中通过一种称为溶解的过程形成的。雨水从空气和土壤中吸收二氧化碳，变成微酸性。这种弱碳酸在渗入岩石裂缝时，会缓慢溶解石灰岩。经过数千年，便形成了地下洞穴。钟乳石和石笋则是由滴水重新沉积的矿物质形成的！
错误。虽然地震会使岩石破裂产生裂缝，但并不会形成我们称之为洞穴的大型空洞结构。洞穴的形成是一个缓慢的化学过程，即岩石被水溶解，而非突然的机械断裂。
错误。风蚀可以在沙漠中形成浅层岩石遮蔽处，但无法形成深层地下洞穴系统。大多数洞穴是由地下水溶解可溶性岩石（如石灰岩）而形成的。风蚀是地表过程，力量太弱，无法创造出大型地下空间。

explanations_en: Wrong. Rocks don't float and accumulate to form islands. Islands are land masses that are part of Earth's crust, connected to the seafloor. They form through volcanic activity, tectonic uplift, or sometimes coral reef growth.

Correct! Islands form through several processes: volcanic eruptions build up land from the seafloor (like Hawaii); tectonic plate movements uplift underwater land above sea level; coral reefs grow on volcanic foundations (atolls); or rising sea levels isolate former mainland areas. Some islands like Japan sit on plate boundaries. The key is geological processes creating land above water!

Wrong. While sand can form barrier islands near coasts, this doesn't explain most islands. Major islands form through volcanic activity or tectonic uplift. Sand movement is a secondary process that might modify coastlines, not create substantial islands.

Wrong. Icebergs are floating ice that melts into water - they don't settle to form land. Islands are solid rock formations that rise from the seafloor, formed by volcanic activity, tectonic uplift, or coral growth, not from melted ice.
explanations_zh: 错误。石头不会漂浮并堆积成岛屿。岛屿是地壳的一部分，与海底相连，它们通过火山活动、地壳抬升或有时珊瑚礁的生长而形成。
正确！岛屿的形成有多种方式：火山喷发从海底堆积出陆地（如夏威夷）；板块运动使水下陆地抬升出海平面；珊瑚礁在火山基础上生长形成环礁；或海平面上升使原大陆部分隔离成岛。像日本这样的岛屿位于板块边界。关键在于地质作用使陆地露出水面！
错误。虽然沙可以在海岸附近形成障壁岛，但这并不能解释大多数岛屿的形成。主要岛屿是由火山活动或地壳抬升形成的。沙的移动是次要过程，可能改变海岸线，但不会形成实质性的岛屿。
不对。冰山是漂浮的冰体，融化后变成水，不会沉积形成陆地。岛屿则是从海底升起的坚固岩体，由火山活动、地壳抬升或珊瑚生长形成，而非由融化的冰构成。

explanations_en: Wrong. Wind creates regular ocean waves, not tsunamis. Tsunamis are different - they're caused by sudden displacement of massive amounts of water, usually from underwater earthquakes. Wind-driven waves only affect the surface; tsunamis involve the entire water column.

Correct! Tsunamis are triggered by sudden vertical displacement of the seafloor, usually from underwater earthquakes at subduction zones. When tectonic plates suddenly shift, they push or pull huge volumes of water. This energy travels as waves at jet speed (up to 800 km/h) across the ocean! Underwater landslides and volcanic eruptions can also cause tsunamis. Wave height increases dramatically in shallow coastal waters.

Wrong. The moon's gravity creates tides - slow, predictable rises and falls over 6-hour periods. Tsunamis are sudden, catastrophic waves triggered by geological events like underwater earthquakes or landslides. They're completely different phenomena.

Wrong. Underwater volcanoes don't boil water to create tsunamis. However, violent volcanic explosions can displace water suddenly, creating tsunamis. But most tsunamis come from underwater earthquakes, not volcanic activity. It's the sudden movement of Earth's crust displacing water that creates these waves.
explanations_zh: 错误。风产生的是普通海浪，而非海啸。海啸则不同——它们由大量水体突然位移引发，通常源于海底地震。风浪仅影响海面；而海啸则涉及整个水体的运动。
正确！海啸通常由海底突然的垂直位移引发，多发生在俯冲带的水下地震时。当构造板块猛然移动，会推动或拉动巨量海水，这股能量以喷气式飞机般的速度（高达800公里/小时）在海洋中形成波浪传播！水下滑坡和火山喷发同样可能引发海啸。波浪在沿岸浅水区会急剧增高。
错误。月球的引力引起潮汐——缓慢、可预测的涨落，周期约为6小时。而海啸是由海底地震或滑坡等地质事件引发的突发性灾难性巨浪。它们是两种截然不同的现象。
错误。水下火山并非通过煮沸水来引发海啸，而是剧烈的火山爆发能突然排开大量海水，从而形成海啸。但大多数海啸源于海底地震，而非火山活动。正是地壳的突然移动导致水体位移，才产生了这些巨浪。

choices_en: Lack of sunlight makes it cold
explanations_en: Wrong. Ice melting would provide cold water temporarily, but there's no ice underground in most regions. Underground water temperature is stable and determined by depth and local geothermal conditions, insulated from surface temperature changes.

Correct! Underground water maintains a relatively constant temperature close to the average annual surface temperature of that location (usually 10-15°C). The earth acts as insulation, protecting groundwater from daily and seasonal temperature swings. This is why caves feel cool in summer and warm in winter! However, water gets warmer deeper down due to geothermal heat from Earth's interior.

Wrong. Rocks don't actively cool water. Rocks act as insulators, maintaining water at a stable temperature. The coolness comes from being insulated from surface heat variations. At shallow depths, groundwater temperature reflects the average annual temperature of the region.

Wrong. Lack of sunlight doesn't directly make water cold - it just means no direct heating. Underground water is cool because earth insulates it from surface temperature changes. The stable temperature is close to the annual average surface temperature. Deep underground, water actually gets warmer from geothermal heat!
explanations_zh: 错误。冰融化会暂时提供冷水，但大多数地区地下并无冰层。地下水的温度是稳定的，由深度和当地地热条件决定，不受地表温度变化的影响。
没错！地下水保持着相对恒定的温度，接近当地年平均地表温度（通常在10-15°C之间）。土壤起到了隔热作用，保护地下水免受日常和季节性温度波动的影响。这就是为什么洞穴在夏天感觉凉爽，在冬天感觉温暖！然而，由于地球内部的地热，越往深处水温会越高。
不对。岩石并不会主动冷却水。它们起到隔热作用，使水温保持稳定。水的凉爽感源于其与地表温度变化的隔绝。在浅层地下，地下水的温度反映的是该地区年平均气温。
错误。缺乏阳光并不会直接让水变冷——这只是意味着没有直接加热。地下水之所以凉爽，是因为土壤隔绝了地表温度变化的影响。其稳定温度接近地表年平均温度。而在深地下，水实际上会因为地热而变得更暖！

explanations_en: Wrong. Wind cannot move glaciers - they're massive ice formations weighing millions of tons. Glaciers move due to gravity and their own weight causing ice to deform and flow, much like a very slow-moving river of ice.

Correct! Glaciers move through two mechanisms: internal deformation and basal sliding. Under immense pressure from their own weight, ice crystals deform and flow like a very viscous fluid - gravity pulls them downhill. At the base, friction melts some ice, creating a thin water layer that acts as lubricant. Glaciers can move millimeters to meters per day! They've carved valleys and shaped landscapes over thousands of years.

Wrong. Ocean currents don't pull glaciers. Valley glaciers move downhill due to gravity, while ice sheets spread outward from their centers. When glaciers reach the ocean, they can form icebergs that drift with currents, but the glacier itself moves due to gravity and ice physics.

Wrong. Earthquakes don't cause glacier movement. Glaciers move continuously and slowly due to gravity and ice deformation under pressure. While earthquakes might trigger ice avalanches on steep glacier faces, they don't cause the fundamental slow flow of glaciers.
explanations_zh: 错误。风无法移动冰川——它们是重达数百万吨的巨大冰体。冰川的移动是由于重力及其自身重量导致冰体变形和流动，就像一条流动极慢的冰河。
正确！冰川通过两种机制移动：内部变形和基底滑动。在自身重量的巨大压力下，冰晶会发生变形并像高黏性流体一样流动——重力将它们拉向下坡。在底部，摩擦使部分冰融化，形成薄薄的水层起到润滑作用。冰川每天可移动数毫米至数米！数千年来，它们雕刻出山谷，塑造了地貌。
错误。洋流并不会拉动冰川。山谷冰川因重力作用向下移动，而冰原则从中心向外扩展。当冰川抵达海洋时，会形成随洋流漂移的冰山，但冰川本身的移动是由重力和冰的物理特性决定的。
错误。地震不会导致冰川移动。冰川是由于重力及压力下的冰体形变而持续缓慢移动的。虽然地震可能引发陡峭冰川面上的冰崩，但它们并非冰川基本缓慢流动的原因。

choices_en: Low rainfall due to air patterns
explanations_en: Wrong. Sand is a result of deserts, not the cause. Deserts exist due to lack of rainfall, which is caused by atmospheric circulation patterns and geographical factors. Not all deserts are sandy - some are rocky or ice (Antarctica is a desert!).

Correct! Most deserts form due to atmospheric circulation. At the equator, hot air rises and releases moisture as rain (tropical forests). This dry air moves toward 30° latitude, sinks, and warms - the sinking air prevents clouds and rain. This creates subtropical deserts like the Sahara! Rain shadow deserts form when mountains block moisture. Cold ocean currents and distance from water also create deserts.

Wrong. While the sun does cause evaporation, this alone doesn't create deserts. The fundamental cause is lack of rainfall due to atmospheric circulation patterns, geographical barriers, or cold ocean currents. Some deserts like the Atacama receive almost no rain for decades!

Wrong. Plants don't grow because it's a desert, not the other way around. Deserts exist primarily due to lack of rainfall from atmospheric and geographical factors. The absence of vegetation is a consequence, not a cause. Some plants do survive in deserts by adapting to extreme water scarcity.
explanations_zh: 错误。沙漠形成沙子，而非沙子导致沙漠。沙漠的存在源于降雨稀少，这由大气环流模式和地理因素造成。并非所有沙漠都是沙质的——有的是岩石或冰雪覆盖（南极洲就是一片沙漠！）。
正确！大多数沙漠的形成与大气环流有关。在赤道地区，热空气上升并释放水分形成降雨（热带雨林）。这股干燥空气向30°纬度移动，下沉并升温——下沉气流阻止云层和降雨，由此形成了像撒哈拉这样的副热带沙漠！雨影沙漠则是因山脉阻挡水汽而形成。寒流和远离水域同样会造就沙漠。
错误。虽然太阳确实会导致蒸发，但这本身并不形成沙漠。根本原因在于大气环流模式、地理障碍或冷洋流导致的降雨稀少。像阿塔卡马沙漠这样的地方，几十年几乎滴雨未下！
错误。植物不生长是因为那里是沙漠，而非相反。沙漠的存在主要是由于大气和地理因素导致降雨稀少。植被缺失是结果而非原因。有些植物确实通过适应极度缺水而在沙漠中存活。

questions.question_en: Why does earth have different layers?
explanations_en: Wrong. Earth's layers didn't form randomly. They formed through differentiation - a systematic process where materials separated by density when Earth was molten. Heavier elements sank to the center while lighter ones rose to the surface.

Correct! When Earth formed 4.6 billion years ago, it was molten from collision energy. Through 'planetary differentiation', denser materials (iron, nickel) sank to form the core, while lighter silicate rocks floated up to form the mantle and crust. This created distinct layers: inner core, outer core, mantle, and crust. It's like oil floating on water - materials separate by density!

Wrong. Volcanic eruptions occur because of Earth's layered structure, they didn't create it. The layers formed during Earth's early molten state through density-driven separation. Volcanoes bring material from the mantle to the surface but don't create the fundamental layer structure.

Wrong. While asteroids added material during Earth's formation, they didn't create the layered structure. The layers formed through differentiation when Earth was molten - denser materials sank to the center, lighter materials rose. Asteroid impacts contributed material but didn't organize the layers.
explanations_zh: 错误。地球的层次并非随机形成，而是通过分异作用——一种在地球处于熔融状态时，物质按密度进行分离的系统过程。较重的元素沉向中心，而较轻的则上升至表面。
正确！地球在46亿年前形成时，因碰撞能量而处于熔融状态。通过“行星分异”，密度较大的物质（铁、镍）下沉形成地核，而较轻的硅酸盐岩石上浮形成地幔和地壳。这造就了明显的分层：内核、外核、地幔和地壳。就像油浮在水上一样——物质按密度分离！
错误。火山喷发是地球分层结构的结果，而非其成因。这些层是在地球早期熔融状态下通过密度差异分离形成的。火山将物质从地幔带到地表，但并未创造基本的分层结构。
错误。虽然小行星在地球形成过程中添加了物质，但它们并未创造分层结构。这些层次是在地球处于熔融状态时通过分异作用形成的——密度较大的物质沉入中心，较轻的物质上升。小行星撞击贡献了物质，但并未组织这些层次。

questions.question_en: Why are fossils found in rocks?
explanations_en: Wrong. Animals don't hide in rocks and become fossils. Fossils form when organisms die and are quickly buried by sediment before they decay. Over millions of years, the surrounding sediment becomes rock while the organism is replaced by minerals.

Correct! Fossilization occurs when organisms are rapidly buried by sediment (mud, sand) after death, protecting them from decay. Over millions of years, sediment layers compress into sedimentary rock. Meanwhile, minerals gradually replace the organic material, creating a rock copy of the organism. Only a tiny fraction of organisms become fossils - it requires specific conditions! Fossils provide evidence of ancient life.

Wrong. Rocks don't grow around bones. Fossils form through a process where organisms are buried by sediment, which then turns into sedimentary rock over millions of years through compression. The organic material is replaced by minerals, creating a fossil within the rock.

Wrong. While sudden burial helps fossilization (volcanic ash, mudslides), earthquakes don't trap animals to create fossils. Fossils form when organisms are buried in sediment that later becomes rock, and minerals gradually replace the organic material over millions of years. It's a slow geological process.
explanations_zh: 不对。动物并不会藏在岩石里变成化石。化石是在生物死亡后、尚未腐烂之前，迅速被沉积物掩埋而形成的。经过数百万年，周围的沉积物变成岩石，而生物体则被矿物质所替代。
正确！化石化是指生物死亡后被沉积物（如泥、沙）迅速掩埋，从而避免腐烂的过程。经过数百万年，沉积层被压缩成沉积岩。与此同时，矿物质逐渐取代有机物质，形成生物的石质复制品。只有极少数生物能成为化石——这需要特定条件！化石为远古生命提供了证据。
错误。岩石不会在骨骼周围生长。化石的形成过程是生物体被沉积物掩埋，经过数百万年的压缩作用，沉积物转变为沉积岩。有机物质被矿物质替代，从而在岩石中形成化石。
错误。虽然突然掩埋有助于化石形成（如火山灰、泥石流），但地震并不会困住动物形成化石。化石是在生物被沉积物掩埋后，这些沉积物逐渐变成岩石，并在数百万年间矿物质逐渐取代有机物质的过程中形成的。这是一个缓慢的地质过程。
